required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 10, 2022
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Strength Exercise on Fall Risk in Elderly With Alzheimer's Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Strength Exercise on Fall Risk in Elderly With Alzheimer's Disease

brief_summary.textblock: Interventional study to show the effects of strength exercise on fall risk in elderly with Alzheimer's disease

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Short physical performance battery (SPPB) at 3 and 6 months
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3 and 6 months (3 months after intervention)
primary_outcome.description: Informs about fall risk and mobility Score: 0-12 High score means better result

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Activities specific balance confidence scale (ABC scale) at 3 and 6 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3 and 6 months (3 months after intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: This questionnaire allows to measure the balance of a person Score: 0-100% High percentage means better result

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Lawton Instrumental Activities of Daily Living Scale (IADL) at 3 and 6 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3 and 6 months (3 months after intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: This tool gives us information about performance in activities of daily living Score: 0-8 High score means better result

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Quality of life Alzheimer Disease (QoL-AD) at 3 and 6 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3 and 6 months (3 months after intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: Through this test we can know the level of quality of life of users who suffer from this disease Score: 0-52 High score means better result

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline FRAIL test at 3 and 6 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3 and 6 months (3 months after intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: This rapid test allows to determine the state of frailty of older people Score: 0-5 High score means worst result

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Mini Mental State Examination (MMSE) at 3 and 6 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3 and 6 months (3 months after intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: This test gives us information about the cognitive performance of the participants Score: 0-30 High score means better result

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Neuropsychiatric Inventory (NPI-Q) at 3 and 6 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3 and 6 months (3 months after intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: This tool allows to specify the neuropsychiatric symptoms patients present Score: 0-36 High score means worst result

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Manual dynamometry at 1,2,3 and 6 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1, 2, 3 and 6 months (3 months after intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: This test allows to quantify force an individual presents in a simple way Score: 0-∞ High score means better result
In this way we can measure the level of perceived exertion during the intervention with strength exercise Score: 0-10 High score means more fatigue

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline One Maximum repetition strength test (1 MR) at 1,2,3 and 6 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 1 , 2 , 3 and 6 months (3 months after intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: Allows you easily to assess maximum strength Score: 0-∞ High score means more strength level

arm_group.description: This is the group that receives strength exercise in addition to usual treatment
This is the group that only receives usual treatment

intervention.description: Strength exercise protocol for upper and lower limbs, using weights and elastic bands
The usual treatment is based on activities to enhance brain functions: attention, memory, executive functions, language and orientation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- accept to participate in the study, through informed consent
- subjects aged 60 or over with medical diagnosis of Azlheimer´s disease
- minimal physical and mental state to perform the cognitive tests and strength exercise routine
Exclusion Criteria:
- Neurodegenerative disease other than Alzheimer's disease
- Suffering from serious somatic or psychiatric illnesses
- Patients who have practiced strength exercise regularly
